result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Albert S Pacheco
Current: 715 Northfield Ave Apt 13, Harvard, IL 60033 United States  (Effective: 01-29-2021)
Prior: 1770 County Rd NN, C/O Walworth County Jail, Elkhorn, WI 53121 United States
BOND QUASHED

Defendant Albert S Pacheco in court, in custody VIA VIDEO with attorney Larry R Pruden.  Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Guilty plea count #1 & #2 20CF73; remaining counts DRI. Minutes filed.

Defendant Albert S Pacheco in court, in custody via audio, no picture with attorney Larry R Pruden.  Samuel Thomas Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State objects to modification of bond to signature. Victim does not object to continuance. If released, Deft would live with his mother in IL, Deft & Victim have a child together. Court makes record as to its concerns if Deft were released. Motion to modify bond by Atty Pruden denied. Motion for continuance granted. Minutes filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 19, 2021 at 10:00 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for March 8, 2021 at 08:30 am.
Letter in Support of Motion to Continue Trial
Deft-Motion to Prohibit Mention of Warrant or Extradition

10:00 am FINAL PRE-TRIAL CALENDAR:  
ADA Samuel Thomas Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   
Atty Larry R. Pruden appears on behalf of the Defendant Albert S Pacheco.   
Albert S Pacheco appeared by video means from the Walworth County Jail.  
Parties are confirming for trial.  
Atty Pruden advises they are waiting for certified documents and records from Milwaukee.  
Witnesses are available for trial and all discovery has been provided.  
There is no resolution at this time.  Court notes that defendant made a speedy trial demand.  
Attorney Pruden says that if defendant's bond could be modified, the trial could be reset.  Response by ADA Berg.  
Court will not allow the other acts unless reports are turned over to the defense.  
Atty Pruden advises there is no discovery owed to the State.  
Witnesses, with the exception of the State's Court Officer and any victim, will be excluded from the courtroom until after they testify.  
Twenty-four Jurors will be seated for voir dire.  Each side will get 5 strikes.  
Jurors can take notes but will not be allowed to ask questions.  
State to file proposed Jury Instructions the Friday before trial.

11:05 am  Court in session.  ADA Samuel Berg appears on behalf of the State.  Atty Pruden appears by phone.  Deft is in the Walworth County Jail but video connection with the Jail did not work.  
Matter is before the Court on the State's Motion to Join and on State's Other Acts Motion.  Atty Pruden has filed a response.  11:07 am  Argument by ADA Berg as to Other Acts Motion.  11:09 am  Response by  Atty Pruden.  11:10 am  Court makes record and addresses the Motion to Join first.  Court addresses Other Acts Motion.  It can show intent, motive, absence of mistake or accident.  It also shows content and may also address credibility of the victim.  These issues are relevant.  Not only are the 2014 events admissible under other acts, but Court will admit all of the 2016 and 2019 acts for that same issue.  16CM687 is admissible as other acts under consciousness of guilt.  Court would have admitted the 2016 and 2019 cases as other acts and are properly joined.  Court grants Motion to Join and Other Acts Motion.  Court addresses scheduling.  We are trying to limit in person appearances due to COVID. Court notes deft is in custody.  A speedy trial demand was made on Sept. 14th.  Court will leave this matter on for jury trial as scheduled.  Parties have been having discussions.  Discussion concerning discovery in most recent case.  Court makes further record that Court could possibly readdress the Motion.  No discovery owed to the State by the Defense.  There is a Final pre-trial on November 24th.  11:21 am  Court in recess.
Deft's Brief in support of Motion in Opposition to Joinder
Application for Jail Time Credit form

Court's reply to State's motion to join:

We will handle at final pretrial, PAK
State's Motion to Join
State's Brief in Support of Motion to Join
Defense

Final pre-trial scheduled for November 24, 2020 at 10:00 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for December 7, 2020 at 08:30 am.

AMENDMENT 7-7-2020: DEFENDANT MAY HAVE TELEPHONE CONTACT WITH DAUGHTER 1 TIME PER DAY BETWEEN 6PM -8PM

TOTAL BOND COVERS ALL FILES 20CF73, 16CM114, 19CM603, 16CM687 & 16CM93
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons. NO FIREARMS. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S):  NO CONTACT WITH VICTIM. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
